The City of Grand Rapids, MI, did a masterful job getting a voter-approved 5-year property tax increase to transform local government.  I'd recommend connecting with them on how they positioned the initiative.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is interested in learning the specific steps/structure local governments have taken to win voter approved ballot measure(s)?  For example:  What steps/actions does a City take to gain the support of voters to receive  a “yes” for the continuation of a local tax that supports various city services.  Not the legal/statutory steps, but rather, the organizational steps City staff and others take in putting together a ballot measure/item to help ensure voter approval?
Whatever information/documentation you can share is appreciated!
